cyclone.name: BERYL
cyclone.current_location: about 925 miles ESE of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-to-west-northwest across the tropical Atlantic, forecast to cross the Lesser Antilles late Sunday/Monday then move through the eastern Caribbean Sea toward the vicinity south of Puerto Rico and Hispaniola
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Dominica in the central Lesser Antilles

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Dominica; Tropical Storm Watch for Martinique, Guadeloupe, St. Martin, St. Barthelemy (no watch posted for U.S. Virgin Islands at this time)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Lesser Antilles, U.S. Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, and eastern Caribbean Islands
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible Monday as the center passes south of the island
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (generally <3 ft) possible along south- and east-facing shores
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could drop 2–4 inches with isolated higher totals, producing localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents beginning late Sunday
